content: Is there a profile canonical URI for the Document Bundle holding the IPS (Composition plus everything?) I did not see one in the IPS publication I looked at.

@John Moehrke I believe this is what you want?
http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/ips/StructureDefinition/Bundle-uv-ips
that looks right. where is this in the IG?

right.. but where is it described. It is not on the Artifacts page, as that is custom and only lists some. It is not explained on the ipsStructure page either. Where is this expained. How does a human reader navigate to find this?
I think there should be minimal details explaining the process of making a FHIR Document Bundle. Point at this profile, and the FHIR document bundling instructions (documents.html).

John Moehrke said:

right.. but where is it described. It is not on the Artifacts page, as that is custom and only lists some. It is not explained on the ipsStructure page either. Where is this expained. How does a human reader navigate to find this?

https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-ips/profiles.html#list-of-profiles coming from FHIR Artifacts - IPS library

okay, so the only way to navigate to this is a small "here" link at the beginning of section 6.3... I missed that link as the bulleted list right below this sentence sure seems to list all the profiles. So it was not clear that there would be anything different on the "here" link.
I think the we should not have both of these, or if we have both of these they should be the SAME.

I agree that probably we shouldn't have both lists. Probably 6.3 (if we keep it) should link to the 'profiles' ("IPS Library") page - and maybe we could somehow add the organization by section and the (R) and (S), if we want to continue to have all of that (maybe as a separate tab on the page, or something like that?).
